title.narrative: IACHR/OSR Special Rapporteur on Freedom of Expression 2018-07- 2021-06

description.narrative: Specialrapportören för yttrandefrihet under OAS, IACHR/OSR; bildades 1997 med syftet att stimulera medvetenheten om betydelsen av att respektera yttrandefrihet hos ansvariga aktörer i OAS medlemsstater. Medlemsstaterna ska uppmuntras att vidta åtgärder som förbättrar de nationella villkoren för yttrandefrihet. Målen med insatsen är att främja yttrandefrihets relaterade rättigheter i Mellan- och Sydamerika.

The Office of the Special Rapporteur was created 1997 to stimulate awareness of the importance of the full observance of the right to freedom of expression and information, given the fundamental role that this right plays in the consolidation and advancement of the democratic system. The objective is to improve the defense and protection of the right to freedom of expression in the Americas.

description.narrative: Example of results (see also CoP/the result summary from 2021-02-12 (dok 005020/21 case 18/000615) IACHR/OSR has in cooperation with OAS/DECO (Department of Electoral Cooperation and Observation) monitored the current legal frameworks and existing restrictions to freedom of expression in electoral processes which has resulted in detailed section on freedom of expression and recommendations to the member states in the final OAS Observation Mission Reports used in statements and dialogue with the e.g. election authorities. IACHR/OSR has also, in cooperation with OAS/DECO, prepared a "Guide to guarantee freedom of expression and to combat deliberate disinformation in electoral contexts". The OAS member states have adopted the Guide. Regarding human rights in context of public protest, IACHR/OSR has produced in cooperation with IACHR and, in consultation with CSOs and UN Special rapporteurs, a thematic Report on Protests and Rights”. The report provides to IACHR systematic standards and recommendations on the obligations of States to guarantee, respect and protect the right to protest. The IACHR/OSR has also trained journalists on how to report violations of humanrights to the Inter-American Human Rights System, which has increased the amount ofcases submitted to the Inter-American Court of Human Rights. To develop the capacityof the judiciary IACHR/OSR has, together with UNESCO, trained judiciary officers(around 4500) in Latin America through online training course "International Legalframework of the freedom of expression, access to public information and protection ofjournalists".
